title: Python Basics
content: Python is a high-level programming language used for web development, data analysis, automation, and scripting. It emphasizes readability and simplicity.

title: Advanced Python
content: Advanced Python covers decorators, generators, context managers, and performance optimization techniques for large-scale applications.

title: Machine Learning Introduction
content: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn from data and improve performance without explicit programming.

title: Supervised Learning
content: Supervised learning uses labeled datasets to train models for classification and regression tasks such as spam detection and price prediction.

title: Unsupervised Learning
content: Unsupervised learning finds hidden patterns in unlabeled data using clustering and dimensionality reduction techniques.

title: K-Means Clustering
content: K-Means is an unsupervised clustering algorithm that partitions data into K groups by minimizing distance to cluster centroids.

title: Data Structures
content: Data structures like arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, and trees are fundamental for efficient algorithm design.

title: Algorithms Basics
content: Algorithms are step-by-step procedures for solving computational problems efficiently using logical operations and control flow.

title: Web Development Fundamentals
content: Web development involves building websites using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and backend technologies like APIs and databases.

title: Databases Introduction
content: Databases store structured information using tables, indexes, and queries. SQL is commonly used for relational databases.

title: Linear Algebra for ML
content: Linear algebra provides the mathematical foundation for machine learning, including vectors, matrices, dot products, and eigenvalues.

title: Probability and Statistics
content: Probability and statistics help quantify uncertainty and analyze data distributions, variance, correlation, and hypothesis testing.
